name: Panzar
description: PANZAR is a fantasy multiplayer third-person shooter. You get to choose from eight unique character classes, team-based PvP battles, exciting PvE adventures and regular tournaments with real prizes. Advanced RPG elements, the non-target combat system and the most modern graphics by CryEngine 3 will make your combat experience...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP Processor: Intel® Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 5600+ 2.8 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® 8800 GT or ATI Radeon HD 4870 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 12 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows® Vista/7/8/10 Processor: Intel® Core Quad Q9450 2.6 GHz or AMD Phenom II x4 920 2.8 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce GTX 470 or AMD Radeon HD 6790 DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 12 GB available space

reviews.review_text: 100% pay to win.
It's 100% pay to win, And sadly im not buying it, thanks bye.

This game looks good on screenshots, but that's about it. In motion you can see inability of autors to even do proper animations (or some variety at least). Combat in game lacks any sence of impact, or enjoynment at all. There really is no point in playing this piece of crap, even when it's free. Yup and there are ton's of bugs ...

Game is awesome. Just you need to play in the morning for USA cuz the player base is mainly UK or Russian, and that is their prime time in relation to our time. If you try to play in late afternoon or late night in USA... prepare for EPIC QUE QUE TIME.

This is unique game with non-target system. To feel how it work you need to try it. No, you MUST try it, cause: - awesome graphics (CryEngine 3 - sounds good, eh?); - nice battle mechanics; - 8 classes; - lots of maps and game modes; - cool in-game atmosphere.  Go on, try Panzar!

This is a very addicting game! Graphics are incredible and the PVP is teamplay and challenges. The most fun I have had in a long time! I give this game a 90 out of 100 and recommend that all STEAM users give this free game a try!

Great game - probably the best MOBA/RPG I've ever seen. Visually it's just awesome, new step in the evolution of free-to-play games. Concerning gameplay - well, here we have some tried-and-true approaches: four standard (to be honest not completely standard - JUST LOOK AT THOSE SCARY ELVES!) fantasy races, eight typical classes, several also typical play modes and a really great amount of different (but always picturesque) maps. Is it entertaining? Oh yeah - especially after level 4 or 5 when a player actually gets enough abilities to choose between them and starts using some strategy thinking instead of constant clicking. Then it becomes just more and more interesting. Can't understand all the fuss around its monetization system. If you don't want to buy smth in the game you can always craft it. The crafting takes some time but it's fair and sensible. NO unique items or any advantages for donaters.
Game is full of crappy launch bugs and really bad animation-wise a little unbalanced for now, but it's fun and the art is stunning. Have a go at it. It's free anyways :D  It is NOT pay2win

First time to go into this game and the tutorial was pretty cool...It got my hopes up for my first PvP. However I had to wait 12 mins to be matched up...I googled this issue and found that this is really common and gets worse at higher levels...There is no incentive to carry on with Panzar and the fun you can get is limited by time...Do not recommend right now but if server issues and waiting times are fixed, it will definitely buyback a large crowd
Viewing the controls simulator, Best Game IGN 10/10

In all my years of gaming I've never played this type of game. I'm really, really enjoying it. Typically play for 8 or more hours at a time. Of course, did the same with War Thunder, Shattered Horizon, The Stanley Parable, etc. I'm a marathon player; I burn the camo at both ends!   Sure, it needs improvements. The game requires a patch immediately after installing it, but it downloads at 56K modem speeds! This isn't the first game that relies on a launcher to update a game, but 100MB taking 30 minutes to download is appalling! And having never played this kind of game I could have used better tutorials on crafting and why I should craft some things over others. And speaking of tutorials, 9 classes equals 9 identical tutorials if you want to earn a class point for each one. And you are forced to watch the same badly done cut-scenes over and over with no option to skip them. Those voices! UGG! Better to just skip the tutorials altogether and earn your first rank by playing a round or two.  The game has various classes and after you get past rank 5 there's supposed to be only 2 of each class on each team, greatly extending the matchmaking wait significantly. But if the devs want to make money (and they do) they will find a way to reduce the wait times. Speaking of which, the money you can spend on this game is for actual improvements to your skills and equipment vs just cosmetic stuff. This can lead to a P2W mentality, but a lot of games survive regardless if they're still fun to play. It's certainly easier to rank up in this game than others I've played. War Thunder would take years to rank up all of your crews if you simply ground your way vs paying to upgrade, for instance. I've spend $85 on that game already!  I'm not very good at reviewing games, so that's all the ramblings of a Christmas Crack Monkey you're going have to put up with for now. Bottom line, I highly recommend this game if you're looking for casual and addictive fun.
The game is gorgeous,considering all terms,but if you don't want to pay or aren't willing to farm REALLY HEAVY for every item,this game is not for you.
very good game!! only probs with the low population, although the que time arent that bad for the low population :)

The combat is very enjoyable, and the graphics are pretty good compared to most games with a bit of humor to the animations. Down side to this game sadly is that there is a very small player base at the moment, if the game catchs on and more people start playing que's to battles should improve, till then its a very very long wait till you get to do much of anything.   Over all 7 out of 10, if battle que's get shorter 9-10 because nothings perfect lol.

Initially the game is fairly basic but errupts into very enjoyable team based combat. I would recommend this game to as many people as possible to help build the playerbase in the US.

So let me sum this game up. This will be comming from someone who likes playing MOBAS regularly.   1. Moba with only a few maps giving you lanes, not the same kind of lanes in a traditional MOBA since, but lanes none the less that allows you to flank and take objectives through an ambush type of take over.   2. Most, if not all other Mobas give you a plethora to chose from of many different character types, set with there own powers and themes. This game gives you the bare bones to which you build off of allowing you to create your own champion, tailored to you and your play style.   3. No item store like DOTA2 or LOL. You literaly build your character through time and progression.  4. You gain materials to build things after each match regardless if you win or lose. The more you win, the more bonuses are gained hence, the faster you can get your items built for your character.   5. 8 classes, many different ways to level each one giving you technically more then just 8 classes.  Tank, Paladin, Sapper, Sister Of fire, Inquisitor, Berserker, Ice Witch, Gunner.   6. The games currency, is a pink gem that you can get through progression and time played along with getting a total of 5 after each time you level. Almost everything is reliant on this, respec, crafting and upgrading. You can literally earn everything honestly without ever going to the item mall.   Over all thoughts thus far  I honestly believe we have something great here. The game is well made on a nice engine and runs very nicely. There are a few graphical gripes, but nothing that completely ruins the game for me or my experience from the over all presentation. This game has a long ways to go before it can hit that sweet spot where DOTA and LOL currently sit at, but this game has the potential of being a staple in the MOBA market, maybe one that can make other DEV teams strive to become or even surpass. Thus far, I am having a blast and I already started to make friends on here and the community over all has been really nice to play with. There are a few toxic members, but thats in every gaming community no matter what you do.   Now to the one spot where everyone wants to know about.   'Item mall is it buy to win'   Buy to win for me is, you can buy all the best weapons in the game and armor at a premium cost and absolutely tank everything and not be effected by early adopters of the game. It's safe to say or atleast from what I have looked at, you CANT do that here. I was reading in the community hub that it was and had to look myself. There are boosts that are offered to get you more of those pink gems, but that was really all the differences they offer, not the crazy armor and weapon buying that people were claiming in the forums. The boost is pretty much you get additional gems with the completion of certain aspects of the game. Not really game breaking considering half the people that do this wont be around very long or just don't have the time to keep up on the boosts themselves and let it expire.   oh and one more thing, the crafting system is pretty nice and offers a similar experience to that of Warframe. Really nice idea to have something that allows us to make our own armors and weapons.   'Now off to work I go, thank you for reading'   Devs, more game types and a server browser please.

Sadly I have to not recommend this game, and being the optimistic, games enthusiast I am, that means a lot. To begin with, the game's recommended system settings are not nearly powerful enough to run the game at any sort of decent FPS. Even having a 4gb of RAM, I had to heavily downgrade graphics for it to be playable. Also the loading times were very long. The options for classes looks interesting, and the 'dwarves' in it have a unique style element of their own, they all wear a sort of bouncy spring shoe to help them move a bit faster. (Personally I am not a fan of the change to traditional dwarves, but I do appreciate the effort.) There is a short, brief tutorial mission on how basic movement & combat works. However once that is up, the game literally forces you to go into a PvP match.  Literally, you can not do any thing whatsoever beyond go and do a PvP match after this. Having wanted to try this game out last night along with Sins of a Dark Age, I figured when no one queue'd up for a game, it was just because it was late/early. Today I queue up again, and after 5 mins of waiting I am already bored and wanting to go check on my AdVenture Capitalist progress instead.  So, I have to give this game a truly atrocious 0/10, as I can not even engage in the core game elements, not even against bots. For a game that is so heavily featured on my store stream, I am sadly disappointed in this title.  Buy this game if you: Dislike actually playing games, and prefer instead to sit at a loading screen, staring blankly.

A brand new player should not have to sit in queue for 30+ mins around peak time. This game is absolutely dead. The one match I did get into had only 5 other players in it, and they were all Russians despite me being on the ENGLISH server.

Very short tutorial that explains the obvious, nearly no ingame feedback, high delay between action and effect (because, u no... animations!!). It is NOT a funny multiplayer game to handle. War of the roses has a far tighter multiplayer experience.  And as any 'good' free to play, expect nice pay to win! Yay...

I didn't really enjoy this game much at all. There's a bit of humor thrown about, but the meat of the game, the actual gameplay, is kinda terrible. The combat feels very floaty and often unimpactful. Tt seems the only time you really do any damage is when you power swing. And casters at the beginning are just comically bad. You only have one spell, for the ice witch it's not even really ranged, and you barely enough mana to use it. I can't speak to its progression model because I frankly could not be bothered to play the game long enough to see if there was any progress to be made.

Panzar's gameplay is Basically Stock MMORPG PVP Que's Wrapped up in the gorgeous Cry Engine 3 and for everything it does right it falls flat on something else.  The Art style and theme bring enough to a simple game to feel as if it was a part of something bigger... But seemingly everything is ripped straight out of Warhammer it's comepletely amazing that this even got on steam with this much stuff completely ripped off.  the Animations are well made. but there is a complete lack of feedback in mellee and ranged combats.  The free to play model is fair, but you will quickly hit a point where sinking money into 'premium time' is clearly the only way the games progression is balanced.  There is plenty of gear slots and assorted things to slot into your gear. but there are only really 2 primary Stats to increase  There are time sinks scattered through the crafting and upgrade systems that feel straight out of an iphone game and seem to only be in place to bait out the inevitible 'ah ♥♥♥♥ it ill spend real money to skip this' you are also at the complete mercy of RNG with crafting mats rewarded after each match for......something.. there are no side objectives or anything to really influence how you get these.. just keep playing and hope.  The Maps are really nice, most of them have moving components and other little quicks that bring some variety in how they are played out.. if only half of the modes where put together correctly. Maps like the Siege of ♥♥♥♥ing orc monkey village is backwards... and has the attacking team already in the castle and pushing out for what will always end up as a 45 minute meat grinder as there is no real way for defencive teams to win on any siege mode maps unless your teams composition completely ♥♥♥♥♥ on the attackers.   i dont reccomend this one. At its core, this is a 5th of your typical mmorpg with an emphisis on milking fans of the genre for as long as they are oblivious to the massive flaws in the overall experience. 10/10goty's
If you think this game is going to be great, think again.

Good, fun team-based PvP game. 8 classes with a bunch of maps and more that unlock as you level higher. Much better game than it appears at first look. If you like PvP it's worth the download. **The upgrading/level system is a bit anti-casual unless you play with your wallet**

Let's start off with that this game has huge potential and is incredibely fun to play. I love the mechanics of how certain classes can counter other classes which balances it just fine, unless your team doesn't cooperate, but otherwise it's a lot of fun.  Really sadly the only and seriously only bad thing about this game is that  it's PAY2WIN all the way which means you can pretty much complete the game using real money, you can get max level, you can get best gear in the game, you can get enough potions to make you immortal for the entire game, you can buy amulets which boost your stats and also you can buy a 'bot' of some sort so when you are not playing then he will 'play' for you resulting in you getting sweet loot without moving a finger, have I mentioned you can buy VIP which almost more than doubles the loot you get?  Example: Once I went into a game withm my level 11 tank with decent gear for which i didn't pay and then further into the game i realised there is a guy on the enemy team who had all the available gear for that level, he even painted it which requires money like the game was so unbalanced because our team couldn't even kill him because he had enough health potions to keep him going for the entire game, he died like only once when our entire team ganged up on him, but that was it he just kept on killing everyone with two blows after that. This experience really proved to me how unbalanced the game gets when someone pays 2 win. This game has amazing potential, but the developers just ruined it with the cash shop.

After 15 mins I still didnt get a game.Now dont get me wrong, This game is solid, I was in the beta and it was fun, but now that no people play this, makes me sad :(. Also that thing you added where you ahve to be level 5 to be gunner and the other class, that is bull crap.I will not recommend this game Untill it gets fixed!

I really enjoyed playing this game in its beginning launch and the next 200+ hours of gameplay over the year. The graphics and battle dynamics are outstanding, and initially it had a good crafting system. The resources you earned verses the cost of crafting higher end armor and weapons was scaled against you steeply but was acceptable. Sometime between 8/10/2014 and 8/11/2014 an update removed the ability to craft entirely, replaced with shop function only. Resources earned now, go towards a roulette game that doesn't nearly adheer to the probability statistics advertised. What was a great game for computer players has been reduced to a cell phone game in leage with 'Kim Kardashian : Hollywood', you meerly pour money in for gear necessary for playing at high level. If they reverse the update launched on above dates I will probably continue playing, otherwise I just cant.

Thats pay to win i dont care if its all unlockable because its a grind and pay to win people can have it now and use it against others. You should have went the cosmetic route with xp boosters and such. Just look at the other reviews and your game got mixed reviews. If the game was good and wasnt pay to win I think we would see much better reviews but we don't. So dont try and convince me your game isn't pay to win lol I have played it enought to know that it clearly is. RIP p2w games  LOL,  -Lord Coldimor   White Wolf [developer] Sep 14 @ 1:40am  Hi,  This game is free to play so we at the Studio want to know exactly why you find this game pay to win. Yes it's Free to play, No you cannot progress and not pay. If you're looking for an actual free to play game move on. to get gear you need to farm parts, it's difficult but that's fun! but when you colleted your parts you have a 70% chance to make the item or it'll break and you lose parts. I played it a bit, it's more like 60% chance of it breaking in actual aplication. To sum it up, it's not free to play past lvl 1.
The game was pretty fun, but they made it excessively pay to win so everyone stopped playing it. Now the queues are endless because the game is dead :(

-Wait times for matches are atrocious. -Horrible respawn rate (PvE). -Clunky combat controls. -Nearly non-existant community. -Unbalanced classes. -Pay-to-Win -Too much 'purchase-from-store' banter.  No point in typing the good things, as this game isn't even worth it with all of the downside. Don't waste your time; there's plenty of other much better free MOBAs out there.

I did't bother to play this game....it looked cool and interesting until I loaded it and got a look at the throw-up in your mouth character design. Wow! Just some of the ugliest characters I've ever seen. They should have you shooting those things instead of being one of them. The female characters are only half way visually acceptable but the costumes look like a make-your-own-character someone did who had cerebral palsy. Wish I could tell you if the game played well but I just couldn't get over those ugly creatures they want me to us as an avatar in the game. Just couldn't do it...

So, after couple years it became hard-try-ghost-town of tutorials. Like an hour of them, that's not what I hoped for unfortunately. After that, there were no servers at all. Dont bother and have a good day!
